text:
Say I have a some regex match:

```julia> m = match(r"(?<sample>sample(?<samplenum>\d+))", "sample1_xyz")
RegexMatch("sample1", sample="sample1", samplenum="1")```
is there a way to get the capture group names from the `RegexMatch`, that is, I want to get `[:sample, :samplenum]`

elements.text: Say I have a some regex match:
is there a way to get the capture group names from the
, that is, I want to get

text:
I don't see anything promising in

```julia> dump(m)
RegexMatch
  match: SubString{String}
    string: String "sample1_xyz"
    offset: Int64 0
    ncodeunits: Int64 7
  captures: Array{Union{Nothing, SubString{String}}}((2,))
    1: SubString{String}
      string: String "sample1_xyz"
      offset: Int64 0
      ncodeunits: Int64 7
    2: SubString{String}
      string: String "sample1_xyz"
      offset: Int64 6
      ncodeunits: Int64 1
  offset: Int64 1
  offsets: Array{Int64}((2,)) [1, 7]
  regex: Regex
    pattern: String "(?<sample>sample(?<samplenum>\\d+))"
    compile_options: UInt32 0x400a0002
    match_options: UInt32 0x40000000
    regex: Ptr{Nothing} @0x0000560bd7860360```
nor
```julia> propertynames(m)
(:match, :captures, :offset, :offsets, :regex)```

attachments.fallback: [April 4th, 2021 10:59 AM] anandj: I have some regex like `r = r"(?<idx>.*)=.*#(?<name>.*)\t(?<unit>.*)"` . What is the way to extract the capture group names `[:idx, :name, :unit]` from `r` ? Same question for a `RegexMatch` . It doesn't seem like I can from reading the regex docs <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/strings/|here>.
